page.title: 18HOMES IN CHAPEL ST.LEONARDS.
page.content: Most people in Chapel St Leonards live in bungalows,many of which have been built in small estates during the last 15 years.Nearly all these buildings are built in brick brought mainly from Peterborogh by London Brick Co.Most of the houses/bungalows are privately owned but there is ine council estate with 20 houses which were built in 1953.Most buildings have sand/cement tiles for roofs but some of the older bungalows have asbestos tiles.The Methodist Chapel and a row of 1930's houses have Welsh slate tiles.There's no piped gas in this area and most houses use electricity,oil or solid fuel for heating and cooking.Some use Calor Gas.Several buildings have used SOLAR PANELS.
